title: Lags or what?
body:
Hi guys.. After patch 5.3 I have one problem and I don't know how could I solve him.. 
Before this patch I had high graphics and everytthing was ok.. No lags.. No problem.. But now I have low graphics 100+fps 30ping and game freezes every +-10sec.. Fps drop from 100 to max.80 but I think that's not the problem. Anyone know how could I fix it or something? Thank you;)

replies.body:
Have you got the latest updates to your graphics drivers and OS?

Could you tell me what they are as well?
Everything is actual.. It never did this before.. Game is now unplayable

Uh...

Are you not able to tell me? I mean, it would make this issue a lot harder to solve if you can't, but I'll respect it if you can't actually tell me for whatever reason.

I don't know what you think but .. GPU driver version was old if it is what you think -  340.52 .. Now actual 347.52
And OS W7 Professional Service Pack 1 ?

Ok, try this: run DirectX Diagnosis (press Winkey+R then type in "dxdiag"). Go to the display tab and tell me what it says for the fields Name, Chip Type, Approx. Total Memory and Current Display Mode. This is basic information about your actual graphics card.

On the right side it has information about your currently installed driver. For Nvidia chips, it should be around 9.18.
Well.. Here it is. I know that current display mode and graphic card are not good.. But the game always worked without lags or something like that.

That works too, I guess.

Could you try setting the refresh rate to something more common, like 60Hz, 59Hz or 100Hz (if your hardware supports it, that is)? 75Hz is a bit of an odd refresh rate, so maybe Riot have just coded something and overlooked people with odd display settings.

Your graphics card should be more than capable of running League on high settings.
Well that's a problem because I have old monitor and I can have only 1600x1200 75Hz.. So I have to buy new monitor right? :D But thank you for help;)

Woah woah woah, you don't have to buy a new monitor. Don't ever think you'd have to buy a new monitor *just to play one game*. That's insanity.

If your monitor can display 1600x1200 at 75Hz, then it will be able to display any resolution under that at a higher refresh rate. That's how monitors work. What options are available in the Windows Control Panel?
Try disabling "Show only frequencies this monitor can support" and see what happens when you try another one. If it works, test out League.
Hi again ... It was ok.. 5 days I was playing without lags .. THey were gone and now they are back.. I really don't understand

It might be another program which is running in the background as you play. I for one know that Windows Vista and above is set to "automatically maintain" your computer at definite integrals, that is various things will happen in the background without it alerting you. These include scans, defrag and updates. It happens on a daily basis, and if a task does not complete in time, then it is scheduled to run in the next instance of maintenance. It can build up over time.

While running League, and while it's lagging out, open your task manager and see if in "Services" the automatic maintenance is running.
